column4: How do you install icon packs (.tar.gz)?  I've tried installing it through "System>Preferences>Appearance" but it gives the error "Not a valid theme"
look inside.  Sometimes they aren't properly packaged, but come with a README.  You need to extract them properly into ~/.icons manually if that's the case
Hmm... this is all the icon packs I've downloaded from gnome-look.org.  They're all packaged wrong? :)
compare the proper icon sets in /usr/share/icons/ with what is in there.  It isn't a proper package
here is a proper icon theme for example: http://www.silvestre.com.ar/?p=125
Hmm... yeah.  Totally different format than ALL the icon sets on gnome-look.org.
no, that page was from gnome-look: http://gnome-look.org/content/show.php/Dropline+NOU%21?content=53292
make sure they say GNOME Icon as type maybe?  Not sure if that is actually adhered to though
Yeah... it does specifically say "GNOME Icon Theme."  And I've tried probably 10 different sets from gnome-look... they're all organized the same.
complain to the author.  Or fix it yourself and send it to him/her: http://live.gnome.org/GnomeArt/Tutorials/IconThemes
I suppose I could do that.
Sorry... I've been having a problem with grub NOT booting windows.  Now looking at my disc structure, it looks NOTHING like what I actually setup.
